author: Kate Davidson
title: White House to Propose More Spending for Infrastructure, Military, Border Security
text:
The White House is proposing increased outlays for the military, border security and veterans’ medical care, the Office of Management and Budget said in a sneak peek of President Donald Trump’s fiscal 2019 budget plan due out Monday, along with $200 billion in infrastructure spending that the administration previewed this weekend.
Beyond that additional spending, though, the administration said it would propose to trim deficits by $3 trillion over the next decade through “an aggressive set of spending reforms” meant to curb...
